segments.text: Hi , excuse me . I am sorry to bug you , but do you know where the Royal Hotel is ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Just a minute . I am as busy as a bee right now ... Ok , I am done . What can I do for you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I seem to be a little bit lost here . I am worried that I ’ ll never find my way . What's worse . I forgot my glasses and as blind as a bat now .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , keep you chin up ! I ’ ll try to help you . Where are you going ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am trying to get to the Royal Hotel . Do you know where that is ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , no problem . You walk down this street . You turn left at the first intersection . Walk along that road , turn right at the corner . After that , you make a left-hand turn at the first traffic light . The Royal Hotel is on your right side .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Great . Are there any landmarks nearby ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , I think so . I think the hotel is right across the street from a post office . It is as plain as the hump on a camel . You can't miss it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , that's good . I should be able to find it pretty easily then . Is that far from here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , it ’ s gonna take you a while if you go by foot . I ’ d say it's about a 30 - minute uphill walk . You have to be as strong as a lion to make it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , that will take too long and I am kind of in a hurry . Can I take a bus there ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , you could take a bus there , but you would have to transfer buses twice . A taxi would probably be a lot quicker .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: All right . I guess I'll take a taxi then . How long will it take by taxi ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not too long . It should take about ten mins by taxi .
segments.speaker: S2
